remarks: Two closed dyadic rational intervals are either in a subset relationship or are almost disjoint (the interiors are disjoint).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Mar-2015.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dyadmbl.1 $e |- F = ( x e. ZZ , y e. NN0 |-> <. ( x / ( 2 ^ y ) ) , ( ( x + 1 ) / ( 2 ^ y ) ) >. ) $.
dyadss $p |- ( ( ( A e. ZZ /\ B e. ZZ ) /\ ( C e. NN0 /\ D e. NN0 ) ) -> ( ( [,] ` ( A F C ) ) C_ ( [,] ` ( B F D ) ) -> D <_ C ) ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d C x y $.
$d D x y $.
$d F x y $.
